section.title: Upgrading CMC and VSA to
section.para: This document describes the procedure to upgrade the existing VSA and CMC version to the latest patch as a part of upgrade of .

section.title: Upgrading the Centralized Management Console (CMC) Version
section.para: The following section describes steps to upgrade the existing CMC to 11.5.01.0099.1 version as a part of upgrade of .

listitem.para: Run hlm-upgrade.yml which includes cmc-upgrade.
2. Terminate the existing CMC session and launch a new CMC session.
3. Click Help on the horizontal menu bar and select About. A pop-up box displays which displays the version of CMC, as shown in the following screen shot, i.e., Version “11.5.01” Build ”0099.1”.

section.title: Upgrading the VSA Version
section.para: The following section describes the prerequisites and the procedure to upgrade the existing VSA 11.5.01.0079 to a new VSA 11.5.01.0099 version .
Ensure that you meet the following perquisites:

listitem.para: hlm- upgrade, which includes vsa-upgrade and cmc-upgrade, has been completed successfully.
cmc-upgrade is completed successfully. (Refer Upgrading the CMC Version to upgrade CMC)
VSA cluster or VSA VMs are in a healthy state.

section.para: VSA upgrade is facilitated by Centralized Management Console (CMC).
The patches that is required for upgrading the existing VSA version (11.5.01.0079) is placed in /home/cmc-installer directory.

listitem.para: Upgrade of management group
Individual VSA

note.para: To extend the existing management by adding a new VSA, you must first upgrade the existing management and add a new VSA. Otherwise mismatch of VSA versions will result in a failure to add a new VSA. (VSAs in existing management is running 11.5.01.0079 version and VSA 11.5.01.0099 is a new version.)

section.para: You can upgrade each Management Group one at a time. Therefor, for multiple management groups, you must repeat the following procedure for each management group you want to upgrade.

listitem.para: Launch CMC and login to management group (mg).
Click Check for Upgrades on the horizontal menu bar and select Upgrade.
Click Click here to stay at current Software version link, a pop-up box is displayed. Select the check box on the pop-up box and click OK.

Click Use Local Media to apply the patches from local media. Now, browse the location where the patch sets are downloaded and click OK. In the following screen shot, the patches are saved in /home/cmc_installer/patch_for_VSA_11.5.01.0079 location.
In respective mg tab, click Continue to proceed to apply the patch sets.
Verify the patches that (namely: 45102-00, 45103-00 and 45104-00) are going to be updated. Click Install to install all the three patches.

note.para: The volumes and snapshots become unavailable during the upgrade.

listitem.para: Wait till patch sets are installed on all three VSA nodes. Reboot of VSA VMs happens multiple times as required.
Select the check box and click Finish to complete the installation. The patches are applied successfully .

section.para: In case you have individual VSA which are not part of the any mg, follow the below procedure to upgrade it to VSA_11.5.01.0099.

listitem.para: Launch CMC and login to VSA.
Click Check for Upgrades on the horizontal menu bar and select Upgrade.
Click Click here to stay at current Software version link, a pop-up box is displayed. Select the check box on the pop-up box and click OK.

Click Use Local Media to apply the patches from local media. Now, browse the location where the patch sets are downloaded and click OK. For example, the patches are saved in /home/cmc_installer/patch_for_VSA_11.5.01.0079 location (refer to preceding screen shot).
In Available systems tab, click Continue to proceed to apply the patch sets.
Verify the patches that (namely: 45102-00, 45103-00 and 45104-00) are going to be updated. Click Install to install all the three patches.
Wait till the patch sets are installed on all of the three VSA nodes. Reboot of VSA VMs happens multiple times as required.
Select the check box and click Finish to complete the installation. The patches are applied successfully.

para.emphasis: For a new installed VSA in

note.para: is delivering a new VSA image version.11.5.01.0099 wherein all the existing 11.5.1 SAN/IQ patches (Patch 45102, 45103 and 45104) are implicit part of it. However, CMC shows Urgent Patches Available for the VSA image 11.5.01.0099.
When a HPE StoreVirtual KVM VSA version. 11.5.01.0099 is deployed with CMC 11.5.01.0099.1, CMC displays the Urgent Patches Available for the VSA.

listitem.para: You can ignore the Urgent Patches Available notification for the VSA version 11.5.01.0099 because the images implicitly have the existing SAN/IQ 11.5.1 patches.
You can apply patches to the VSA version11.5.01.0099 image because there will be no functionality behavioral change with applying patches on it but this will reboot the VSA.

note.para: Patches contains security fixes and cannot be ignored for the older VSA image (version 11.5.01.0079).

para.emphasis: Identify the version detail of KVM with VSA

listitem.para: Perform the following to identify the version details of KVM with VSA:
From the HPE StoreVirtual Centralized Management Console (CMC), in the navigation window, select the StoreVirtual VSA.
Select the Details category tab.
The VSA software version will be listed in Software Version attribute.
